thread.title: With Welinski Back, UMD Has Familiar Feel
thread.title_full: With Welinski Back, UMD Has Familiar Feel

title: With Welinski Back, UMD Has Familiar Feel
text:
With Welinski Back, UMD Has Familiar Feel 
By Zach Schneider October 5, 2015 Updated Oct 5, 2015 at 10:16 PM CDT 
Duluth, MN (NNCNOW.com) --- The University of Minnesota Duluth (UMD) men's hockey team will open the year as the nation's No. 2 squad and with plenty of expectations, leading plenty of people to draw comparisons to the national title team of 2010-11. 
Head coach Scott Sandelin isn't wild about comparing past and present, but he does admit there's one big similarity between the championship team and this year's roster. 
Click here to subscribe to our daily newsletter. 
"The fact that Andy [Welinski] came back and it's like Mike Montgomery, who could've signed [after his junior season]," Sandelin said. "It's a key defenseman for us and our captain. That's probably the only similarity that, for sure, is like 2010-11." 
Welinski, a native of Duluth, Minn., contemplated signing a professional contract with Anaheim after last winter but decided to return to UMD for his senior season. 
Now, he's ready to lead and learn during his last hurrah at UMD. 
"Whether I lead by example in the room, do the right things, or say the right things, it's part of the game," he said. "I think that's a good thing to learn. It's going to help me grow as an individual, and hopefully I can help my teammates at the same time." 
UMD will open the 2015-16 season Oct. 9 at home against Bemidji State. Faceoff is set for 7:07 p.m., and that game can be seen in the Northland on the My 9 Sports Network.
